premises: If a file is corrupted, then it cannot be opened
incorrect conclusions: The file is corrupted and it cannot be opened
If the file can be opened, then it is not corrupted
If the file cannot be opened, then it is corrupted
If the file is not corrupted, then it can be opened

premises: If a program has a syntax error, then it will not compile
conclusions: The program does not have a syntax error
incorrect conclusions: The program has a syntax error
The program has a syntax error and it will not compile
If the program compiles, then it has no syntax error
If the program does not compile, then it has a syntax error
If the program has no syntax error, then it will compile

premises: If the database is down, then the application cannot connect
incorrect conclusions: The database is down and the application cannot connect
If the application can connect, then the database is not down
If the application cannot connect, then the database is down
If the database is not down, then the application can connect
